intro: Shehbazia, commonly known as the "false dandelion," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. These plants are typically herbaceous, with alternate leaves and showy yellow flowers that resemble those of the dandelion. Shehbazia species are native to various regions in Asia, Africa, and the Americas. They often grow in disturbed soils and can be found in grasslands, wastelands, and along roadsides. The genus includes several species, some of which are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
